1500193696196796417.text: Happy #WomensHistoryMonth! It's no secret that Montana has a long history of trailblazing women. From Jeannette Rankin, to Elouise Cobell, to the changemakers breaking down barriers to this day, we celebrate the women who work to create a brighter future for the next generation.

1500162322077294593.text: President @ZelenskyyUa said that banning Russian oil and gas imports is one of the toughest financial hits to Putin’s regime we could do. Earlier this week, I joined a bipartisan, bicameral group to introduce a bill that’ll do just that—let’s get it passed immediately.

Transparency makes our democracy stronger.

These commonsense reforms will help ensure our democracy works for everyone—not just the wealthy and well connected. (8/8)

1484618235777593355.text: And last but not least, my Spotlight Act shines a light on dark money donors and gives the government the tools it needs to enforce our campaign finance laws, reversing a Trump-era rule that eliminated donor disclosure requirements for certain tax-exempt organizations. (7/8)

1484618234359865347.text: The Honest Ads Act would require disclaimers on digital ads and require large online platforms to keep a public database of who is purchasing political ads—ensuring digital ads have the same requirements as those on TV or radio and letting folks know who is paying for them. (6/8)

1484618232925495296.text: The DISCLOSE Act would keep foreign actors from participating in American elections and increase transparency for major donors, so Montanans know exactly who is paying for the constant ads that flood their TVs and mailboxes during election season. (5/8)

1484618231507791873.text: The Cleaning Up Washington's Act, another bill of mine, would close the revolving door between D.C. lobbyists and Capitol Hill by banning former members of Congress and the Executive Branch from lobbying for five years after leaving civil service. (4/8)

1484618229951696903.text: I've also got the SUN Act, which would bring political spending out of the shadows by requiring tax-exempt non-profit organizations that engage in political activity to publicly disclose information about their big money online donors. (3/8)

1484618228437598209.text: My Corporations Are Not People Act is a constitutional amendment that would overturn the Supreme Court's harmful Citizens United decision and declare once and for all that corporations are NOT people. (2/8)

1484618226793431046.text:
Citizens United is one of the worst decisions SCOTUS ever made. It opened the dark money floodgates and gave special interests too much power over our elections.

1425172159677280258.text: Ultimately, my bipartisan legislation is about two things: creating good-paying jobs for Montanans and ensuring we remain the leading economic power in the world. This bill does that and more, and I’m proud to have worked with Republicans and Democrats to get it passed.

1425172156699271170.text:
Water 🚰💧
 
Water is life. This legislation completes all authorized Indian water rights settlements in Montana, and I secured $1 billion to complete all authorized rural water projects through the Bureau of Reclamation, as well as up to $100 million for the Milk River Project.

1425172155206184967.text:
Fire Resiliency 🧑‍🚒👨‍🚒
 
Fire season has gotten worse year after year in Montana, and that’s why this bill includes $3.37 billion to reduce wildfire risk through additional funding for firefighter salaries, research, and community resiliency.

1425172153847226368.text:
High-Speed Internet 💻📶
 
This legislation provides billions to expand high-speed internet to underserved areas and it will increase connectivity in every corner of Montana so we can create good-paying jobs and grow our small businesses.

1425172152605675537.text:
Roads and bridges 🛣🌉
 
Montana’s economy depends on safe, efficient travel across our state, and this package invests roughly $2.82 billion to repair and upgrade Montana’s roads, highways, and bridges.

1425172150261108744.text:
Months ago I joined 4 Democrats and 5 Republicans to invest in our nation’s critical infrastructure needs, create good-paying jobs, and maintain our economic advantage over China.

1290725679529693185.text: We are asking our colleagues to stand against the threat of corporate consolidation and stand up for rural America. Our cattle industry is at a crisis point—if we don’t act fast to stabilize cattle markets, the folks that work hard to feed this nation will be run out of business.

1290725678825054208.text: My colleague @ChuckGrassley and I are pushing a bill that requires large packers to buy 50% of their total cattle purchases on the cash market, increasing transparency and making pricing more fair for family ranchers. But we need more folks on both sides of the aisle to join us.

1290725678061694976.text: Meat packers have been taking advantage of small-scale beef producers for years. And as COVID-19 continues to disrupt production capacity, independent ranchers are facing closures. Rural America feeds this nation—if we don’t act, our nation’s food security will be at risk.

1290720140758319104.text: For too long, corporate consolidation has hurt the livelihood of Montana ranchers, and we’ve got to act. Soon, I’ll be joining my colleague @ChuckGrassley on the Senate floor to discuss our push give ranchers more power to negotiate fair prices on the cattle market.

Lawrence VanDyke is clearly unfit for a position on any court, but the Majority Leader wants to give him a lifetime seat.

1179873090353778688.text: Thanks to everyone who came out to MSU Billings today to have a frank conversation about the issues facing our state and our country. I always appreciate hearing from you and that you hold me accountable. I’m looking forward to seeing you at my next in-person town hall.

1179856253553709068.text: Took a question about dark money in our elections. Let’s be clear here, corporations aren’t people and Montanans know that. If you put a bill on the floor of the Senate that clarified that, it would pass.

1179853909181030400.text: Was just asked about civic engagement. The decisions we make today will have a tremendous impact on young people in this country. As leaders we can inspire the next generation by keeping politics out of our decision making and doing what’s right for the country. It’s that simple.

1179851937925287936.text: I just got a question about suicide rates in Montana. I've got a bill to address this crisis that would be a good start, but we have to keep pushing. We need more mental health professionals on the ground and we have to reduce the stigma around mental health in rural America.

1179849966916911109.text: Was just asked about our climate. We’ve got ice sheets that are melting, we’ve got oceans that are rising, we’ve got bugs in our crops and in our forests that we've never had before. We have to work together to do something about our changing climate.

1179846322444292103.text: Just got a question about legislative gridlock in the Senate. We're supposed to be the greatest deliberative body in the world, but we don't debate much anymore. If we actually did the work of debating the issues, I think we'd come up with a whole heckuva lot more solutions.

1179844914198253569.text: One of the first questions is about protecting public lands. Let's be clear, one of the things that makes Montana great is our public lands. You don't have to be a millionaire and own a ranch to go hunting or a stream to go fishing. I'm always going to fight to keep it that way.

1156953599429304324.text: Wildfires can be devastating. The last thing folks recovering from the aftermath of a fire need to worry about is filing their taxes. My bill will help Montanans by giving them more time and flexibility to file so they can focus on what matters most – safety and recovery. https://t.co/a0BamnwAsC

1156300487584563201.text: Folks in Montana have shown Washington the way — now it’s time for Congress to follow Montana’s lead.

1156300358949441536.text: There’s no reason why we cannot make smart investments in working families, our children’s education, and 21st century infrastructure without bankrupting the future for our kids and grandkids.

1156300126194937856.text: It is possible to be fiscally responsible without cutting working folks off at the knees — I negotiated and passed a balanced budget while serving as the President of the Montana Senate.

1156299937434546176.text:
Spending is about priorities. 

It’s clear that Congress’ priorities are out of whack.

1156299810900783105.text: These same colleagues that added this 2 trillion dollars of debt are now arguing we don’t have enough money to provide for our veterans, pay for Medicare, Social Security, and other programs that protect hundreds of thousands of Montanans.

1156299304396566530.text:
They promised this tax giveaway would pay for itself — it did not. 

In fact, it tacked 2 trillion dollars into the national debt.

1156299082639581187.text: My Republican colleagues passed a partisan tax giveaway that was drafted behind closed doors with no public input form Montanans.

1156298883967922176.text: Our debt is not skyrocketing because we are spending it on things we need like updates infrastructure or investments in education — it’s skyrocketing because of irresponsible spending.

1156298636315299845.text: The bipartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget projects that this Administration’s policies will add 4 trillion dollars to the debt over the next ten years.

1156298374045478912.text: This week, we will vote on a bill that swipes Washington’s credit card to the tune of about 250 billion dollars over the next two years — dollars are coming from the pockets of our kids and grandkids.

1156298068511338497.text: As usual, Washington could learn a lot from Montana.

1156297896284839937.text: Folks in Montana are resilient and resourceful — they know how to live within their means.

1156297713408978947.text: As I travel across Montana, I hear from folks who work tirelessly everyday to make ends meet — families facing the ever-rising costs of housing, healthcare, and other basic necessities.

1156297446168961026.text:
I’m headed to the Senate floor in a few moments to discuss how Montana common sense can help solve our skyrocketing national debt. 

Tune in HERE ➡️ https://t.co/S215HKxj00

This bill will NOT:
